intro: Coluteastrum, commonly known as the "false holly," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Their flowers are small and inconspicuous, clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Coluteastrum species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and adaptability to various growing conditions.
